<style>
/* 1. Hide the default Quarto title header */
#title-block-header {
  display: none;
}

/* 2. Force all Quarto layout containers to be transparent */
/* Added .quarto-container to this list */
#quarto-content, 
#quarto-margin-sidebar, 
.page-columns, 
.quarto-container,
main {
  background: transparent !important;
}

/* Define the Fade In Animation */
@keyframes fadeInUp {
    from {
        opacity: 0;
        transform: translateY(20px); /* Starts slightly lower */
    }
    to {
        opacity: 1;
        transform: translateY(0);
    }
}

.text-block {
  position: relative; 
  z-index: 1;
  /* Apply the animation */
  opacity: 0; /* Start invisible so it doesn't flash before fading in */
  animation: fadeInUp 1.5s ease-out forwards; 
  animation-delay: 0.5s; /* Optional: Wait 0.5s before starting */
}

/* 3. Bring the sticky container forward, but ignore mouse clicks */
.sticky-container {
  position: fixed; 
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100vw;
  height: 100vh;
  z-index: 0;  /* CHANGED: Brought up from -1 to 0 so it sits on the canvas */
  pointer-events: none; /* NEW: Ensures clicks pass through to links/text */
  margin-bottom: 0; 
}

/* 4. Ensure the text sits ON TOP of the animation */
.text-block {
  position: relative; /* NEW: Required for z-index to work */
  z-index: 1;         /* NEW: Puts text above the z-index: 0 animation */
}

/* Note: You had a .content-wrapper class defined but not used in your HTML. 
   I applied the necessary logic to .text-block above instead. */

html, body {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  height: 100%;
  width: 100%;
  overflow-y: auto; /* Changed to auto so you can scroll if text gets long */
  background-color: #000;
}
</style>

<div class="sticky-container">
<iframe src="collatz_visual.html" width="100%" height="100%" style="border:none;"></iframe>
</div>

<div class="text-block">
I have a noisy brain. I'm also forgetful. In an attempt to organize that noise, and to help me remember things, I've started this website to share things that I find interesting. 

Most writings will have a data science flavor, though I make no promises. This website is powered by coffee, so if you find any of this helpful and would like to support my work, consider <a href="https://buymeacoffee.com/justan3ngin33r">buying me a coffee</a>.

The animation on this page is of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collatz_conjecture">collatz conjecture</a> and was inspired by <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Collatz_conjecture_tree_visualization.png#/media/File:Collatz_conjecture_tree_visualization.png">this visual</a>.
</div>
